definition: to be in operation/to do business/(of train, bus etc) to be in service/operation/service
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
operator (of a power station, transport network etc)/carrier (telecommunications etc)

sentences.english: The new Asia-Pacific Hub is expected to be fully operational the first half of 2009.
sentences.chinese: 新的亞太集散中心預期在2009年上半年全面運營。

sentences.english: Honing machine tools of a new generation have also gone into production.
sentences.chinese: 新型珩磨機牀已經投入運營。

sentences.english: Commercial projects need to be financed in operation period.
sentences.chinese: 運營期融資主要是針對商業房地產項目而成立。

sentences.english: The maintenances of the radio sites affect greatly the quality of service of the mobile phone network.
sentences.chinese: 基站維護對提高移動網絡的運營質量具有重要意義。

sentences.english: Fares are valid on Greyhound schedules and those of participating interline carriers.
sentences.chinese: 該票價在灰狗和那些參加聯營的運營計劃內有效。

sentences.english: The whole municipality battlement ward normal runs the for-rent car of camp currently only 300 is probably.
sentences.chinese: 目前全市城區正常運營的出租車大概只有300臺。

sentences.english: In Fujian and Zhejiang, another coastal province, train services were suspended, flights canceled and fishing boats called back to ports.
sentences.chinese: 閩浙兩省的高鐵暫停運營，航班被取消，漁船歸港。

sentences.english: Perform any operational duties for the organization or its affiliates.
sentences.chinese: 代組織或其機構履行運營職責。

sentences.english: It also has a “whole lot of planes” to keep in the air, as she puts it.
sentences.chinese: 她指出，亞航也保有“一大批的飛機”在運營中。

sentences.english: A well-run organisation will also, in all likelihood, give a good account on the punctuality front.
sentences.chinese: 運營良好的組織將同時很可能提供良好的準時記錄。

sentences.english: Requires operator to re-enter user name and password before an action is taken.
sentences.chinese: 運營商需要重新輸入用戶名和密碼之前採取行動。

sentences.english: With 5G, carriers could also deliver super-sharp 4K video to the home.
sentences.chinese: 通過5G，運營商可以向住戶家提供高清4K視頻。

sentences.english: Located in Suzhou Xiangcheng Economic Development Zone, we plan to start our operation in 2016.
sentences.chinese: 公司計劃於2016年下半年開始正式運營生產。

sentences.english: The group runs the three factories through its two Hong Kong-listed vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 該集團通過兩家在香港上市的公司運營這三家工廠。

sentences.english: But the wind business is new to Exelon, the nation's largest operator of nuclear power plants.
sentences.chinese: 而風業務是新艾斯，全國最大的核電站運營商。

sentences.english: The competition structure of the broad-band service market in Shanghai has been formed.
sentences.chinese: 上海寬帶業務運營市場的競爭格局已經形成。

definition: running/operation (of airport, bus service, business etc)
to exploit (a resource)/to open up (for development)/to develop
to engage in (business etc)/to run/to operate
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
